variant.question: Evaluate what is possibly achievable in commercial aviation in respect of flight safety.

options.text: Risk should be decreased as much as commercially possible.
In commercial aviation, risk should be reduced as much as possible.
Risk should be eliminated wherever possible.
Risk should be recognised and considered as being inevitable in commercial aviation.

variant.question: A pilot is performing a sight-seeing flight with tourists on board and is asked to give them a good view of the mountains. There is a risk to the safe conduct of flight due to...

options.text: atmospheric perspective.
black hole effect.
size constancy.
autokinesis.

variant.question: The relevance of check procedures during flight becomes even more important when

options.text: flying an unfamiliar type of aircraft and experiencing mental pressure.
flying an aircraft which you have flown many times before.
flying an aircraft which you have flown recently.
conducting a longer flight than you would normally perform.

variant.question: A pilot is performing his annual simulator check ride. Though the flight is uneventful and the climate is good, the examiner notices that the pilot is very nervous and seems overly concerned about failing. What could be a possible reason for this?

options.text: External factors may affect the pilot.
The behaviour of the examiner may have caused the anxiety.
He may suffer from motion sickness.
Nothing, that level of stress is normal during an evaluation.

variant.question: Although the anticipation of possible events is a good attitude for pilots to acquire, it can sometimes lead to hazardous situations. Select the response below which could lead to such a hazard:

options.text: mishearing the contents of a reply from an air traffic controller when a non-standard procedure was given but a standard procedure was anticipated
anticipating that the weather may deteriorate
anticipating that the flight will take longer time than planned
anticipating the loss of an engine
